example.title: Fender Jazz Bass
example.p: The fret board joins the nut, over which the strings connect to the tuning keys, which in combination forms the head. Derived from the traditional basic forms, the Fender Precision bass and Fender Jazz bass have different breadth of necks. The P-bass has width of approximately 45 mm (1.75 in.) at the nut, the J-bass is only about 38 mm (1.5 in.). Each is a 4-string bass. The narrower J-bass neck enables a more nimble movement along the fret board, and is more suited for smaller hands.
